results.description:
On Friday, June 12, 2015, MSW will return to one of its favorite summertime locales for a weekend of "glamping," at beautiful Smoke Hole Resort in Cabins, WV.  From there, we will launch on spoke rydes to include Blackwater Falls State Park, WV, and Cumberland, MD to enjoy the Western Maryland Scenic Railroad.  We're still working on sites and stops in between, scenic overlooks and miles of sweepy, twisty, beautiful road.  Approximately 170 miles from the meetup/departure point, we will ryde out to Smoke Hole on a leisurely, scenic route.  Our return route on the 15th will be approximately the same distance, but varied from the outbound trek to keep it interesting!

Our hosts at Smoke Hole Resort were wonderful to us last year, and we anticipate another welcome and now the warmth of friends made with the staff there.  We will have three catered dinners in their main lodge, a special treat because they don't just serve us dinner.  They lay out the same wonderful meal that they themselves share as a family.  This saves us from having to ryde into Petersburg for evening meals and allows us to conclude our evenings in the peaceful environs of the resort.  Catered meal costs will be billed proportionately to each guest's lodging.

For those who were not with us last year, Smoke Hole offers its fascinating caverns tour approximately two miles south of the resort, along with a gift shop stocked with local treats and souvenirs. The accommodations are wonderful ... log cabins featuring heart-shaped tubs, a  pristine bathroom, fireplace, kitchenette, excellent WiFi and 4/5g reception.  If a little rain comes by you can enjoy it from your own covered veranda on the front of each cabin. 

Lodging Info:  Again, Smoke Hole is our base 'glamp' on this tour.  Our Event Coordinator, Laura Donnell, has secured us a block of 10 Honeymoon Cabins (for couples), at $149 per nite; also, two "Family Cabins" at $229 per nite (**best deal for single ryders wishing to pair up).  For those wishing a bit more economy, there is also the option of the Smoke Hole Log Motel, co-located with the gift shop and caverns.  No block reserved there, but last year they were going in the high $80s-90s range per night.  Contact for the Smoke Hole is toll free:[masked]; or phone: (304) 257-4442.  Check out their website at www.smokehole.com.

See you in June!  :-)
results.name: MSW Smoke Hole - Appalachian Highlands Tour

results.description:
UPDATE:  May 23rd

Hi All, 

We are considering two options for Saturday morning group activities, either activity could start around 10am and then we could do a picnic lunch before heading down to New Hope for the afternoon.

- kayak on Lake Nockamixon rentals through Nockamixon Park Boat Rental (no reservations required, 1st come 1st serve)

single kayak is $15 per hour

double kayak is $25 per hour

SUP $25 per hour

- horseback ride around Lake Nockamixon, horses and guide through Haycock Stables (reservations are highly suggested,[masked])

         $35 for apx one hour trail ride around lake with guide

Please post comments below on which activity you might prefer.  Thanks!  :)

BREAK....

Let's hit the road for a weekend get-a-way to scenic Bucks County, PA!  We have a rare opportunity to stay at a historic converted 1818 barn on a 10 acre horse farm.  This property known as Stone Ridge Farm was previously operated as a Bed & Breakfast.  


There is so much to do within a 30 minute drive from our barn to include historic sightseeing, nature, premier antiquing, shopping, dining, kayaking, hiking, horseback riding, you name it!    Quaint and historic towns of New Hope, PA and Lambertville, NJ are a must see and are separated only by the DE River. 


We can decide which activities to do as a group or individuals can carve out their own itinerary!  You may just want to stay back and enjoy the barn!  :)


The barn can accommodate up to 18 people but for now we are capping out at 15 max due to the bed configurations.  The cost will be between $146 - $224 per person for the weekend  depending on which room you choose and how many people you choose to share it with.  Some rooms are perfect for couples and some rooms are perfect for individuals who do not mind twin beds.  If anyone prefers a room & bathroom to themselves I can accommodate that as well for a higher cost.

Once you RSVP please email me directly ([masked]) so we can discuss your room options.  I will then assign you a room and send you a paypal link to secure as well as the address.


I plan to book us a one hour trip on the New Hope/Ivy Land Train featured on PBS's Scenic Railroads special http://gsrj.com/pages/rrinfo/pa/newhope.html.   (Participation is optional and cost will be minimal.)  More info to follow...


Washington Post article featuring Stone Ridge Farm from when it was a B&B...


http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/03/11/AR2010031101812.html
results.name: R&R or adventure in beautiful, historic Bucks County, PA!

results.description:
Vegan Potluck with Documentary excerpts ("Fed Up")
and Welcome to New Guests

Friday, June 12, 2015

6:30 PM

Join the Nutrition As Medicine Meetup group: http://www.meetup.com/Baltimore-Nutrition-As-Medicine-Potluck/events/222477700/

Hosted by a primary care physician.

After the film the discussion will be basic tips, tricks and advice on cooking methods, etc., and health aspects of plant-based, whole-foods eating  (similar to what we talk about anyway).

The new folks primarily want to lose weight and get healthy, and are at least open to the idea of a whole-food, plant-based diet eventually.   Of course we will be welcoming, helpful and judgement-free.  We're all traveling on this journey together.

It is very significant that most of our new guests were referred to us through their doctors! This is an exciting new partnership with primary care providers in nearby community health centers:  Jai Medical (across the street) and Park West Health Systems (with several locations, including one in our building).   This is unique, as far as I know, and there's a chance we can influence the practice of medicine as the doctors begin to see their patients shed pounds and get off their diabetes and blood pressure medicines!

Some attendees (including new folks) may have some experience with plant-based whole-food eating and can serve as informal "coaches."   The Meetup host, Joe, will facilitate an exchange of phone numbers and emails for those interested, to keep the dialogue going between meetings.  
This is inspired by the volunteer coaches in Baltimore's annual Vegan Living Program, except that it's ongoing.

There are two schools of thought on helping people with this kind of lifestyle change. One is the "motivational" approach, or "meeting people where they're at," in which people do whatever they feel ready to do, and are gently encouraged to go further (to the extent that they want).   In another approach, people who make a commitment to eventually go all the way are selected. This allows people to feel better, see results, and have their taste buds change.  However, we're providing support to anyone who wants it, and there are no commitments required.

Wherever you are in the spectrum of lifestyle change, novice or expert, this will be a fun and rewarding evening, with plenty to learn for everyone.
results.name: Vegan Potluck hosted by a doctor. Excerpts of "Fed Up" and discussion, support.

We'll show excerpts from the fantastic new documentary 'Fed Up,' and also welcome a new group of people, mostly from Park Heights, who are new to this kind of eating.  

I'm very excited that we'll be joined by a group of beginners.  After the film the discussion will be basic tips, tricks and advice on cooking methods, etc., and health aspects of plant-based, whole-foods eating  (similar to what we talk about anyway). 

The new folks primarily want to lose weight and get healthy, and are at least open to the idea of a whole-food, plant-based diet eventually.   Of course we will be welcoming, helpful and judgement-free.  We're all traveling on this journey together.  

It is very significant that most of our new guests were referred to us through their doctors!   This is an exciting new partnership with primary care providers in nearby community health centers:  Jai Medical (across the street) and Park West Health Systems (with several locations, including one in our building).   This is unique, as far as I know, and there's a chance we can influence the practice of medicine as the doctors begin to see their patients shed pounds and get off their diabetes and blood pressure medicines!   (I'm a primary care physician myself, and used to work at Park West).  

I'm hoping that some attendees (including new folks) who have some experience with plant-based whole-food eating will serve as informal "coaches."   I'll facilitate an exchange of phone numbers and emails for those interested, to keep the dialogue going between meetings.  As always, I'm available for coaching anytime [masked];  joeadamsmd [at] gmail.com), and am enthusiastically participating in coaching as well.  I have accompanied members on grocery shopping trips and visited kitchens of participants, and will do so again if needed.  
This is inspired by the volunteer coaches in Baltimore's annual Vegan Living Program, except that it's ongoing. 

There are two schools of thought on helping people with this kind of lifestyle change.  One is the "motivational" approach, or "meeting people where they're at," in which people do whatever they feel ready to do, and are gently encouraged to go further (to the extent that they want).   In another approach, people who make a commitment to eventually go all the way are selected.  This allows people to feel better, see results, and have their taste buds change.   However, we're providing support to anyone who wants it, and there are no commitments required.   

Especially if the new folks and their referring doctors see results, we'll have more and more beginners to work with, so I expect we'll move to at least twice-monthly in-person meetings, with plenty of contacts in-between.   

Wherever you are in the spectrum of lifestyle change, novice or expert, this will be a fun and rewarding evening, with plenty to learn for everyone.  I hope you'll join us!

Speaker: Robert E. Ulanowicz, Professor Emeritus of Theoretical Ecology

Time: Friday, June 12 at 7:30 pm, and Saturday June 13 at 10:30 am.

Location: Loyola University North Charles Street Campus, McManus Theater

The 33rd annual Cosmos & Creation Conference, a symposium focused on the relationship between science and religion, will take place at Loyola University Maryland’s North Charles Street campus on Friday, June 12, through Saturday, June 13, 2015. The lectures are open to the general public. The speaker is Robert E. Ulanowicz, Professor Emeritus of Theoretical Ecology with the University of Maryland's Chesapeake Biological Laboratory and Courtesy Professor with the Arthur R. Marshall Laboratory of the Department of Biology, University of Florida. The titles of his presentations are: "Science and Belief in a Contingent Universe", Friday, June 12, 2015 at 7:30 p.m., and "Ecological Metaphysics: Room for a Creator", Saturday, June 13, 2015 at 10:30 a.m. These talks tend to have a religious philosophical theme about the relationship of science and religion, so atheists who have no tolerance of religious apologists may want to skip it.
results.name: Loyola University's Cosmos & Creation Conference

The 33rd Degree is an unplugged, up, close & personal experience with poet Rebecca Dupas. The event showcases new poems, a few favorites from her most recent CD, "Decade Three" and performances from special guest artists. $15 advance tickets end Sunday, June 1st. Space is limited. Admission is $20 at the door. Grab tickets at www.rebeccadupas.com. Be sure to leave your name(s) for the Will Call List.

Bio:

Rebecca, a Louisiana native, is an educator, photographer and award-winning poet whose writing, performance, and contribution to the poetry community has been recognized in Philadelphia, Baltimore and beyond. Rebecca is the founder and creative director of A DOSE OF DUPAS, an event-based poetry company that houses several events to include Coffee & Critiques, a writer's circle, and "Come On Son!", a four- woman poetry collective. This poet, producer, event host & educator has published four CDs of original poetry and recently published a book entitled "The Exchange" in May 2013. Rebecca has appeared on TedxTalks, Centric, Fox 5, and OneMicTV.com. Her recent tour included appearances on C- Span & PBS News and in The Washington Post alongside President Clinton.

PigPen Theatre Co. began creating their unique brand of music, film, and theatre as freshmen at the Carnegie Mellon School of Drama in 2007. *** If you are attending this practice, please don't forget to sign up on our website by clicking the "Sign Up" link at the top. ***


The BDBC open practices occur every Wednesday from 6:15 to 7:30 PM and Saturday mornings from 8:00 to 9:00. For those of you that have never participated in dragon boating before, here are a few handy things to know to make your experience more enjoyable:

- The club has never flipped a boat during practice so the odds of you going completely into the water are very low but please keep in mind that there can be a significant amount of splashing on board. Chances are good that you will get a bit wet while we're out there so you should dress accordingly. Wear clothes that you won't mind getting wet in.

- As far as footwear goes, some people like to paddle barefoot, some like to wear flip flops and others like water shoes of some sort. Sneakers and shoes like that are usually a bad idea since they can get pretty wet and uncomfortable pretty quickly. - Although the club normally tries to have a cooler available with bottled water, it's not a bad idea to bring a bottle with you to practice to take on the boat. During the summer months especially, it can get pretty warm out there and we like to hydrate regularly.

- The seats on the boat are not the softest in the world and your butt will most likely be a bit sore after practice. To soften the seat a bit, it is recommended that you bring some sort of pad. There are many different options that our club members use and some of the most popular are gardening knee pads and folded up bath mats. A bunched up towel will suffice as well. - Other handy items that you may want to bring with you are sunglasses, sunscreen, gloves and a hat.

- Life jackets and paddles are provided to everyone.

- There is not room on the boat to bring much else with you so please leave everything in your car/on land.

- There is a secure waterproof bag available to collect everyone's car keys when we get on the boat.

- The point of our open practices, is to get people familiar with the sport of dragon boating while demonstrating proper technique and timing. Our coaches are excellent at explaining the mechanics of paddling a dragon boat and working towards the ultimate goal of having all twenty paddlers working as a single unit to move as efficiently through the water as possible, all while having a whole lot of fun! More information can be found at <a>www.baltimoredragonboatclub.com.</a> Hope to see you there!
results.name: Open Practice

results.description:
The Maryland Food Bank needs an accurate estimate of how many people will be volunteering for this event, so please update your RSVP as soon as possible if you aren't able to make it to this event.

=======================================


IMPORTANT VOLUNTEER INFO:

Open-toe shoes are PROHIBITED at the warehouse.  Wear clothes that you don't mind getting dirty (which probably won't happen, but it's a possibility).

Please arrive to the warehouse ON TIME.  We can't begin until EVERYONE is at the warehouse.

Additional volunteer info can be found at the MD Food Bank's website, at www.mdfoodbank.org.


=======================================

The Maryland Food Bank was founded in 1979 to coordinate the procurement and distribution of food donations from manufacturers, wholesalers, retailers and government agencies to organizations providing free food to the state's hungry.

 

Volunteers usually work on a high-tech conveyor belt in the warehouse, pulling specific types of food from the belt as they pass, and packing the sorted food into 25 - 50-pound boxes. Full boxes are then placed on the Maryland Food Bank's daily menu, available for more than 600 soup kitchens, pantries and shelters across the state to order.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in the volunteer meeting area, which is on the left side of the lobby.
results.name: Maryland Food Bank

results.description:
Gardening Day!

Sat. June 13 @ 9am – 1pm

Gardening is a meaningful way to cultivate self-love, respect for the environment, and respect for others. Like meditation, gardening provides an opportunity for stillness and to listen to nature and our own inner peace. This gardening day will help us slow down to share our energy and time with the Earth through community gardening.

The benefits of getting your hands dirty in the ground are so notable that today an entire clinical field is developing around it. Horticultural Therapy uses plants and planting to help people adjust to difficult and traumatic experiences; it has been credited with improving all aspects of their lives — social, educational, psychological and physical.

Join us for a day of relaxation, gardening and growing! Everyone is welcome. Gardening experience is a plus.

Location: KMC Maryland Gardens for World Peace, 900 East Northern Parkway, Baltimore, MD 21212

Cost: Donations are accepted and appreciated!
results.name: Gardening Day!

results.description:
Want to try out trail running without the pressure of having to keep a certain pace??  Or just want a casual paced run/walk in the woods??  Come on out and join us! 


We'll keep a slow pace running, walking/resting as the group needs, and no one left behind (and we mean that!).

These trails are technical and challenging with several steep climbs, rocks, roots, loose dirt, and uneven surfaces.  To make up for all of the hard stuff, there is also a good amount of flat and downhill sections.  We’ll also be sharing the trails with mountain bikers, hikers, and other runners.  

The distance is between 3.5 - 4.5 miles total.  Time will be around an hour.

Trail Description:

The Soapstone trail is about 3 miles, out and back. It has several hills and climbs, creek crossings, and a bit of asphalt running. Most of the trail is wooded and there are bathrooms and water fountains mid-way. There will be some water crossing, dirt and muddy areas, rocks, and sticks...so please wear shoes you don't mind getting dirty or wet.  We can also hit the Bull Run trail for 1 extra mile.

Parking:

Parking is available at the Park and Ride in Catonsville (intersection of Rolling Road/MD 166 and 195) or at the trail head (just across the street).  We will meet up at the trail head, look for the group of runners.

Hope to see you there!
results.how_to_find_us: We will gather at the trail head (across Rolling Rd. from the Park and Ride)
results.name: Beginner Trail Run/Walk - Patapsco Soapstone and Bull Run Trail (Catonsville)

results.description:
The weekend of the 13th and 14th I will lead a hike on the John P Saylor Trail in Pennsylvania. The John Saylor trail is a pleasant little trail in central PA to the east of Johnstown in the Gallitzin State Forest. It is a figure eight composed of two loops (one being smaller than the other) and is your typical Pennsylvania forest walk on the Allegheny Plateau thru beautiful forest. In some ways it is a smaller version of the Allegheny Front Trail. The terrain is relatively easy and being on the plateau it will be a little cooler than DC.
We will start from the Lost Turkey Trail parking on Route 56 and hike counter clockwise to the bridge over clear shade creek that connects to the smaller loop. The area around the bridge is very scenic with Hemlock trees and a beaver dam. From there we will hike the smaller loop. We’ll shoot for a nice meadow campsite at the far end of the far loop, complete with picnic table and an old Adirondack shelter (tent recommended). There should be reliable water within ½ mile of the shelter. Depending on the pace of the group we may keep going and camp at clear shade creek. Sunday we finish up and should be out before lunch and head for a good meal on the way home. For more information see:
http://www.midatlantichikes.com/johnpsaylor-bp.htm

Additionally, please review the following notes:
• Please print or download a map. See the link in the description for a good map

• By RSVPing to this trip or any other DC UL trip, you agree to DC UL'swaiver liability terms.

If you are an applicant please send me a gear list of what you intend to bring.
results.name: LM: John P Saylor Trail (20 miles)

Meet at the Ultimate Water Sports area in the marina at 9:45. We'll start kayaking at 10 when they open. I want to get there before the crowd and before it gets hot.

You can bring your own kayak and put in on the beach. They also rent kayaks for hourly and daily rates. Check the site for details. I think it is $20/hr for a sit-in kayak and $15/hr for a sit on top kayak. PFD and paddle are included.

The max they will charge you is for 3 hours. I plan to be out for a long time and make the best use of my rental cost. :)

This is a flat water kayaking event. There are two paths we can take. Head East then North to go around the peninsula and head toward the Hammerman Beach location. If we hug the coast it is about 12 miles of total distance. If we make a bee line it is about 10 miles and about 3.5 hours. We'll go as far as the group is comfortable and has time for. There is lots of great wild life to see on the way. Last time I saw an entire family of foxes this direction.

Or we can go South and meander along various coastlines that look to be inhabited and built up and make it to Middle River Airport. Also about 8-10 miles round trip.

Bring a hat, water, sunscreen and clothes you don't mind getting dirty and wet. And don't bring your phones unless you have a well sealed bag for it. I killed a cell phone last year that was in two ziploc bags.

There will be a post-kayak lunch at Double T diner at the intersection of Ebenezer and Rte 40.

This is cross posted with the 20s/30s hiking around Maryland group.
results.name: Kayaking - Gunpowder at Dundee Creek

Come on out for one of our monthly plant walks, a great way to learn about edible and medicinal wild plants in-the-field, to verify your plant identification with a local expert, ask questions, and meet other like-minded folks. Each of our Spring foraging walks will take place in a different local landscape and ecosystem, to offer participants a rich exposure to the wide range of local edible plants and mushrooms. Each season also offers new opportunities for encountering edible plants, and for identifying familiar plants in different stages of growth. So come out and learn with us throughout the year! Suggest materials: unlined journal/sketchpad, writing utensil, comfortable walking shoes, and water.

The registration maximum is 12.
$10 per participant, per walk
The exact meeting location of each plant walk will be emailed to the registered participants.

*Notice of cancellation for a plant walk or cooking demo must be submitted to us at least 24 hrs prior to the start of an event in order to request a refund or credit.

Instructors: Eric Kelly & Victoria Greba

results.description:
Saturday Laid Back Social Paddle at Magothy River Days


Saturday June 13th will find us on the water promptly at 10:30 AM from a very special location on the Magothy River.  We will be joining the crowd at Deep Creek Marina and Restaurant to celebrate Magothy River Day with the Magothy River Association (MRA).

Laid Back Social Paddles have in previous years been limited to what are perhaps less popular but still beautiful venues like some of the local reservoirs.  This year we're trying to offer more opportunities to get to some of the special places that have usually in the past been reserved for what I consider to be our premium weekend paddles.

Get there a little early and have your boat ready to launch by 10:00 so you can attend a special classroom style kayak instruction presentation by Chuck for MRA members.

After the presentation we will get on the water for a 7 to 9 mile paddle along the shores of the Magothy from Deep Creek.  Spending on the weather and water conditions we might head out on the Bay to Sandy Point Park or seek the more protected waters going upstream from Deep Creek for about 3 hours.  

Have a late breakfast as we won't be making a dedicated lunch stop but will wait until we return to the Deep Creek Restaurant where we can take advantage of a special for the day limited selection menu in honor of Magothy River Day.  

Deep Creek Restaurant is well know for their great food having won the "Best of Annapolis" award in 2012 from Annapolis Magazine and the "Reader's Choice Award" from The Capital Newspaper.  

Throw in some live music and this event turns into one of the great little local festivals in the area.  It's all for a great cause to help MRA continue to promote, preserve and protect one of my favorite rivers in the area, the Magothy.  Come see why I think it's so special

Rental kayaks (including a PFD and paddle) are available for this special event at the rate of $45 for the day.  Members who pay the voluntary annual dues get a $5.00 discount on all rentals.  To reserve a kayak for this event please be sure to answer the rental question when you RSVP.

The special menu for the day at Deep Creek Restaurant includes

Crab Cake Sandwich, French fries $17
Cobb Salad $15
Cheeseburger, French Fries $15
Shrimp Salad on Croissant, french fries $15

All the above come with a small Caesar salad, unlimited coffee, tea, and soda
Tax and gratuity to be added
results.name: Saturday Laid Back Social Paddle at Magothy River Days

results.description:
This event is now available for signups as of May 3, 2015

Please note that we had to change the date of this cruise due to availability of boat slips and the motel.

 CSA skippers are planning a cruise to Fairlee Creek on the Eastern Shore on June 13&14. We have been there before, and it was a great hit with all the members. The skippers will stay overnight at Mears, Great Oak  Landing Marina which has a pool, restaurant,  tiki bar on the beach, and music on Sat. night.

We have arranged space at the motel to allow for additional crew who cannot stay on board, due to limited berths available for sleeping on the boats. Note that there may be as many as four in each motel room.

Skippers will be departing their marinas on Saturday morning and returning by Sunday evening.

The Great Oak Landing Marina is really a resort area with a golf course, tennis courts, live music on Sat night, etc., so they charge a high fee for an overnight slip. So to share the cost of this fee the CSA must charge each member a $45 fee for this cruise.  If you want to let skippers know of your desire to go on this cruise, please RSVP here now, and send a check to Diane Derr made out to CSA. (You will be sent the address when you RSVP). We have had a good response from the skippers, and expect several boats to join this cruise; however, we don't know the exact number of boats available yet, so the number of RSVP's is unlimited. A balanced crew will consist of new club members, those who haven't cruised in a while and those with sailing and/or cruising experience. If it turns out that we cannot accommodate you, we will refund your payment. RSVP's will close 10 days before the event.

We will plan a cookout on the outdoor grilles at the resort, and will need to coordinate food for the cookout. This will be determined after we know who is actually going.

This event is for paid CSA Organization members only. If you're not a current member, you can join and pay your dues by going to the "more" menu -"Files" submenu, download, complete and submit a membership form. Also, you can pay your $40 annual dues by sending a check made out to CSA to the address on the form.

results.description:
- I am trying to work out a discount for our group to help offset the $4 cost to enter the park, which must be paid in cash.

Come spend a relaxing afternoon kayaking on the flatwater at Gunpowder Falls State Park. This will be the fifth year I have done this event and it is always a lot of fun. Rent "sit on top" kayaks for one hour, two hours, or the entire day and explore the waters with the group, or venture off on your own. If you are interested you can also rent wind surfers, Catamarans, and Stand Up Paddleboards. Prices and directions can be found on the website, but if you rent a two-person kayak it will be about 20 dollars each for two hours. While exploring the water trails we often see beavers, osprey, blue herons, and sometimes eagles. After we spend some time getting exercise, we can head over to the Sunset Cove and have some food on the water while listening to live music. I recommend bringing a change of clothing, water, sun screen, and going potty before getting on the water since it is illegal to beach the kayak anywhere but the park.

- We usually go out for a couple of hours, but you can go for more or less if you want, and then head to Sunset Cove for lunch. Sunset Cove is an outside bar/restaurant located in Essex. People who own their own kayaks are welcome to bring them as well. We will be meeting at 10:30 by the picnic tables next to the kayak rental area.

Doug

http://www.ultimatewa...
results.name: flatwater kayaking w/ food and drinks at Sunset Cove

results.description:
Welcome to Warrior Meditation!  

 These meditation sessions are non-secular and available to anyone wishing to meditate.   All experience levels are welcome. 

During this session, I'll be offering 4 rounds 10 to 15 minutes of Shamatha Meditation (also known as Calm Abiding, or Mindfulness meditation).   I have been practicing this form of meditation since 1990, and learned the technique in the Nyingma School of Tibetan Buddhism.   

 Each session will consist of instruction in the meditation technique, meditation rounds, and a free form discussion following. This is designed for anyone who wishes to learn/practice Calm Abiding meditation. Once this technique is mastered, we can begin work on the techniques of Insight Meditation as well!

Cheers!
Terri

results.description:
A walking tour of Annapolis, including the Naval Academy, the harbor, the State House, Church Circle, historic homes, St. Johns College, and more. We'll take in the view of Annapolis from across the Severn River at our starting point, Jonas Green Park, then cross the Naval Academy Bridge to the academy. After touring the academy we'll head down to the harbor area for lunch at a dockside restaurant (or bring your own). After lunch, we'll wend our way around the old town, visiting the State House, St. Anne's church, St. John's College, and notable colonial and post-colonial homes, before trekking back over the academy bridge to our starting point.

Note: There is a one-time, lifetime group membership fee of $5, payable at the hike. Non-members pay $2 for this hike only.

Total Distance: 6 miles

Dogs: Allowed, leashed

Leader: Ken Meyercord, (571)[masked]

Directions: From the beltway in Maryland, take US 50 east to Annapolis, exiting onto Ritchie Highway south after crossing the Severn River. results.description:
This is one of our favorite paddles around the Eastport neighborhood of Annapolis. The route includes scenic Spa Creek and Back Creek, as well as Ego Alley by City Dock where all the tourists hang out. For one affordable afternoon, you can enjoy the same Annapolis waterfront ambience as the rich folks hanging out on their million-dollar yachts. 

Annapolis Canoe & Kayak on Spa Creek will again be our base for rentals and launching kayaks. For those launching elsewhere, we'll all meet at the ACK dock on Spa Creek around 11:30 am.

Meetup Details

Gather at the ACK store at 11:00 am to fill out rental forms, pick up gear, and walk down to the dock where the ACK staff will get people launched safely. Renters can make advance reservations by phone and pick up their equipment at the store. 

People who have their own kayaks can launch them from the ACK floating platform dock or the nearby public beach launch on Spa Creek at the end of First Street where street parking is generally available. ACK permits SHR kayak owners to launch for free from their dock. Just be careful not to get in the way of the staff handling rental boats.

Everyone should be in their boats and ready to paddle around 11:30 am, so be on time. We'll assemble on the water as a group by the ACK dock to began our paddle up Spa Creek. 

The ACK store is located in the heart of Eastport which is a crowded residential area with limited street parking and little room for unloading kayaks. Even if you own a boat, you should consider renting a kayak from ACK to avoid parking and unloading hassles. They have quality boats already on the dock and their staff will get you launched safely. 

Total paddling distance will be approximately seven miles and should take about three hours. Bring a wide-brim hat, sunscreen, and plenty of cold water to stay hydrated.

Skill Level

This event is suitable for anyone with basic kayaking skills who feels comfortable paddling in close proximity to the larger boats that use Annapolis harbor. Spa Creek and Back Creek are home to many power boats and sailing yachts that can create wakes and wave turbulence. You should expect to encounter some choppy water and swells along the way. Stay to one side away from the main channel so you don't get run over by large boats that can't see kayaks or maneuver around them. 

ALL PARTICIPANTS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR THEIR OWN PERSONAL SAFETY

Our group of recreational kayakers look out for each other, but we're not certified experts at rescuing novices. SHR paddle events have been very successful because we stick together in case anyone needs assistance.  

Rental Details

As a well-known kayak vendor, ACK maintains a large fleet of quality rental kayaks. Advance full-day kayak reservations can be made with a credit card by calling ACK directly at[masked]-2303.

Making a full-day advance reservation costs $50 for a plastic kayak and guarantees that you will have your chosen boat when you arrive. It's also the best value since the hourly rate is $20 and we're likely to be paddling for three hours. Rentals include a paddle and life jacket. Composite rental kayaks cost $25 per hour.

Complete information can be found on the ACK website:

http://www.annapoliscanoeandkayak.com

Afterwards at the Boatyard Bar & Grill

The Boatyard Bar & Grill is a great place to eat, drink, and hang out just one block from the ACK store. Our SHR group goes there often and always has a good time. Check it out:

http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-boatyard-bar-and-grill-annapolis

Weather Considerations

This event depends upon good kayaking weather. I'll post a notice and send out an email by 9:00 am if we need to change plans or cancel. A little rain is okay and can add to the adventure. But we won't paddle in dangerous conditions such as lightning, high winds, or excessive heat. 

Call Jake at[masked] with any questions. I can't always answer my phone at events, but you can try.

Driving Directions

Don't trust your GPS going to Eastport. It will most likely direct you through the crowded streets of downtown Annapolis. Here's the best route coming from the Washington or Baltimore area.

From Rt 50 East, take Exit 22 (Aris T. Allen Blvd/MD 665) and stay straight on MD 665. After about a mile, the road name changes to Forest Drive. Keep going straight on Forest Drive and turn left onto Hilltop Lane at the traffic light just past the Safeway.  Then follow Hilltop Lane (which changes name to Tyler Ave) straight all the way to the light at Bay Ridge Ave.

Turn left onto Bay Ridge Ave and keep going as it bears right onto Chesapeake Ave at the Eastport shopping plaza. Drive down Chesapeake Ave for several blocks and turn left onto 4th St to Severn Ave. Take a right on Severn for one block to 3rd St. The ACK store is on the left corner and street parking is usually available nearby.

The Eastport neighborhood has several one-way streets. Check the Google meetup map above to familiarize yourself with the street layout.

I hope to see you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the ACK store at Third St. and Severn Ave. in Eastport
results.name: Kayaking Spa Creek in Annapolis - Reserved Rentals Available

results.description:
Self-hypnosis training workshop for women and teens: This course offering is a training in self hypnosis which helps you learn to relax completely thus immediately reducing your stress. While in hypnosis you can easily imprint your subconscious mind with positive messages. In this workshop you will learn to easily achieve a hypnotic state and to write effective suggestions to achieve a goal. Self hypnosis can be utilized to reach many goals in life such as: to relieve test anxiety, improve concentration , relieve insomnia, reduce pain, increase self confidence and self esteem among other goals. Also learn three powerful and effective ways to instantly calm yourself in the midst of a busy day. In addition, you will experience two guided healing meditations sessions . Handouts and a signed copy of the book:"Heart to Heart:The Path to Wellness" is included in the class fee. I am honored to be a contributing author to this book series which features 43 extraordinary true-life experiences written from the hearts and minds of inspiring authors, including Dr. John Demartini and Bob Doyle(both featured in the movie, "The Secret." ) This book will inspire you with the understanding that anything is possible.
Class fee is $44.00 which can be paid through the 'make a payment' tab on my website: www.womenstherapeutic.com or you may bring a check with you on the class date. A percentage of the class fee always benefits the House Of Ruth,  www.hruth. com -- Please contact me throughout our meet up site or please feel free to contact me at: [masked] or at :[masked] for any questions, concerns or further information needed. * Class size limited to 10 students. Please wear loose, comfortable clothing . You are welcome to bring pillows and /or a blanket for the guided meditation portion of our class. I hope so much to see you there!
With many thanks, Dr. Mary Sidhwani

Our next Charm City H3 Trail is part of a special event, Tour Duh Hash where people from all over the DC-Baltimore-MD-VA area can hash with 12 different groups over the course of 10 days. 


There will be a TON of people who don't usually hash w/ CCH3, so come on out and meet some great hashers from all over the area.


Charm City's installation will be at a special day and special time:


Saturday June 13th,


Prelube 12:30pm Java Moon Cafe  (inside Penn Station)


Pack Away Saturday 1pm. Meet in front of Penn Station


Theme: Glitter Bomb, Hon!!! 


Dress as a glitzy Bawlmer Hon or in the shiniest glitter-cover gear you can find.


Note:  If you have old shoes and knee-high "shiggy" socks, you may want to bring them (along w a dry pair of shoes to change into after the trail ends), as there may be a few parts where we run through woods/mud/streams.  We'll have a walkers trail for anybody who wants to come have fun, but stay dry and take it easy.

The other Tour Duh Hash trails are all within an hour of Baltimore and lots of Charm City hashers will be carpooling to some of them.  If you want to explore what other kennels have to offer and meet some awesome hashers along the way, come with us!! 


If you aren't on our email list (which is the best way to stay updated w/ CCH3), post a message here and one of us can help you find out more info.

See Full Trail Notes below

NEXT CCH3 TRAIL = THIS SATURDAY!!

CCH3 Trail #71:  GLiTter Bomb, Hon!

Join us for Charm City's leg of Tour Duh Hash where we'll show you a glimpse of just how sparkly our city can be.  Come as your best glitzy Bawlmer Hon!!  If you're unfamiliar, use the movie "Hairspray" or Google Images for inspiration.

We chose a commonly used, easy-access point to start trail, but don't let that fool you!  This ain't your typical trail.  We got some fun things in store for you wankers that you will not want to miss.  We'll be sure not to neglect the Glit

ter.

Hares: I'm Tho Thor, She Has Small Hands, Oedipants, Just Kim and a mystery hare.

SPECIAL DAY/TIME
Saturday June 13th
Prelube 12:30pm
Start 1pm

Prelube:
Java Moon Cafe
(Inside Penn Station)
$2 yuengling and rail drinks starting at 12noon on Saturday


Start:
Baltimore Penn Station
1500 N. Charles St.  21201
(Follow Marks to Start)

On-After:
Turps Sports Bar
1317 N. Charles St.  21201
$2.50 Natty Bohs and PBRs all day long


Hash Cash: $10

Additional Trail Notes: Trail will be A to A'  with a Walkers trail and a Runners trail with Turkey / Eagle split.  Eagle trail will be a Ballbuster.  Walkers trail will be stroller friendly.  Dogs on leash should be ok, but not at the on-after.  Runners will encounter a bit of shiggy and wetness, so a dry bag is recommended.  ......and...Glitter!!

Bring ID on Trail. Bring a Vessel (or buy one from our Habadashery!!). Yes we will have a bag vehicle.

Better start styling your best Bawlmer Hon beehive hairdo, cause it's gonna be epic!

results.description:
Are you interested in learning to cook more wholesome foods for you and/or your family? God wants us to take care of our temples and we know in a world where fast food is quick and easy it can become our "go to". 

I haven’t always eaten real food. In fact, for much of my life, I ate foods that were decidedly not “real” in any way, shape or form. Growing up on a pretty conventional, standard diet of processed, convenience and refined foods, I had a lot of work to do as an adult. I began to take back my health after being diagnosed with high cholesterol and being over weight. 

In this monthly meetup, we want to offer up information, along with a heaping dose of grace. We will celebrate small changes, the little victories we make in being healthier. Food should be enjoyable and not a difficult or stressful thing. 

If you just want to learn how to add something different to your "same old same old" weekly menu, please come out and join us as well. The best part...we get to eat what we cook (YES!).

I will ask that all who RSVP bring an ingredient for the recipe(s) of the month. I will send a message to all the week of the event letting them know what to bring.

First up vegetable lasagna and zucchini ravioli with side salad and strawberry lemonade.
results.name: We Laugh, We Cook!

results.description:
A most unusual adventure for 1st-level goblin characters.

The Licktoad goblins of Brinestump Marsh have stumbled upon a great treasure—fireworks! Yet unfortunately for them, the tribe member responsible for the discovery has already been exiled for the abhorrent crime of writing (which every goblin knows steals words from your head). To remedy this situation, the Licktoads’ leader, His Mighty Girthness Chief Rendwattle Gutwad, has declared that the greatest heroes of the tribe must venture forth to retrieve the rest of the fireworks from a derelict ship stranded in the marsh. In order to prove themselves as the Licktoads’ bravest goblins, the PCs must complete a series of dangerous dares, from swallowing bull slugs and braving the dreaded Earbiter to dancing with Squealy Nord himself. Yet even once they’ve proven their mettle, the adventure is just beginning. For the ship in question is far from uninhabited, and Vorka the cannibal goblin would like nothing better than a few tasty visitors....

REPLAYABLE AT LEVEL 1

Casual meetup for new and old members to share some snacks and beverages, get to know one another and talk about upcoming events!  Note: the Severn Inn is our summer/fall Meet & Greet location and is a change of venue from our winter/spring site (Crush Winehouse).  

Hors d'oeuvres will be served.  Drinks are on you!
results.how_to_find_us: Right at the bottom of the north side of the Academy Bridge (Route 450).
results.name: Member Meet and Greet

results.description:
Hello Ladies, 

Let’s worship the Lord in song, a sing a long that is! We all know that music is a powerful ministry. Whether we are going through a difficult time or if we need some encouragement, Christian music helps us to focus our energy on God, what he has done and what that means for us as his daughters. Me and Nene compiled songs below that we would like to sing, but feel free to add songs (with artist name) to the list (in the comments section). We will have the songs playing from a t.v. and will also have the lyrics displayed. We will begin the evening with some fellowship and food and then start the sing along. (We will most likely ask the person who selected the song why they selected it.) This meet up will be at my apartment in Laurel. Will send the address next week. Parking is available, no parking sticker/paper needed. My number is[masked]-0651. Here are a few songs we will sing:

Jamie Grace-I Love The Way you Hold Me 

Francesca Battistelli-He Knows my Name 

Capital Kings – You’ll Never Be Alone 

Colton Dixon-More of You

 Matt Maher-All the People Say Amen 

Mandisa – Overcomer

 Kari Jobe – I am not Alone 

Newsboys-God’s Not Dead

 Steven Curtis Chapman-Do Everything

 Third Day-Children of God

Big Daddy Weave -Yours will be 

Hillsong-Here I am to Worship

William McDowell - I Give Myself Away 

Matt Redman- The Heart of Worship  

Maranatha music-Open the Eyes of My Heart

Michael W. Smith-This is the Air I Breathe
results.name: A Christian Sing -Along (Worship)

results.description:
I was asked for a date sooner than 6/27..... 6/13 was the earliest date I could find. In order to keep events affordable, I use the Brooklyn park library. Its the only affordable location I could find in Baltimore

This is a class still on a basic level as you will only learn one method of install. (Depending on how the quickly the class grasps this technique, I can also demonstrate how to make the extension hair invisible). This class teaches how add hair extensions to natural hair for cornrows and plaits.

 Advance: $20                             At the Door: $25 CASH ONLY

ALL ethnicities welcome.

Price include all tool needed for this class. Comparitive value for this class $50
results.name: Hands on Training - Learn to add hair extensions to cornrow & plait

results.description:
From the whispering shadows of haunted Ustalav an ancient evil rises to grip the world in a new age of horror!

Amid the mists of this land of dark superstition and dread secrets stand both those who would defy the return of evil and those who would seek its terrible favor. Can the heroes discern their allies from their enemies in time to save a tortured realm from a tyrant’s return? Pathfinder’s darkest and most frightening campaign ever sets the heroes against the agents of Golarion’s most notorious villain, the Whispering Tyrant, in a terrifying trek across a land of lurking horror and ancient mysteries.
results.name: Carrion Crown Adventure Path

results.description:
Whether for nets, fishing lines, bow-drill strings, lashings for shelter-building, or for constructing tools or vessels, cordage making is an indispensable skill for primitive living. In this class we’ll bring a fine and thorough focus to this art. Participants will learn several cordage making techniques for various strengths, aesthetics, & purposes, and each with different local plants, such as dogbane, yucca, tree cambium, and roots. Participants can expect to complete multiple finished sections of cordage to take home. Participant maximum: 8 people

Instructor(s): Mangy White Bushman, Victoria Greba


Registration is required for this workshop. Visit http://www.charmcityfarms.org/cordage-from-plant-fiber/
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be meeting at the Clifton Park Food Forest in Baltimore. Directions will be emailed to the registered participants.
results.name: Cordage from Plant Fiber

results.description:
The Weather is getting better! Join our group for our SIGNATURE event! Starting with YOGA! See Presenter Statement below! Volleyball, Swimming and MORE! 

And other activities if thats not your thing! Keep posting your ideas as well! Happy Hours, Runs, Fundraisers, nothing turned away! 

The MOST Relaxing event between DC and Maryland .

Watch the Orioles and Nats on WALL TO WALL TV's While enjoying awesome, NATURAL Activities below!

Keep supporting ALL of our meetups, suggest new ones and see you NEXT Saturday!


**FLASH!!! Event start time is 5:30 and NAKED YOGA Starts at 6pm!

**YOGA Room available 7-10 this saturday for DIY Events you choose!

**Thanks to your Organizer for allowing us to share the event!

Interested in June events (By popular demand) Answer this message with "I am able to attend Saturday's in June! ) Announcement pending

We’re getting ready for a GREAT Saturday Night! Summer dates and weekend trips will soon be announced . Wherever you are , Maryland, DC, Virginia or travelling to join us and using the hotel or hostel option we have a GREAT Evening in store for May 9th and 30th!

Swimming – Volleyball (Court or Water) – Yoga – Massage Therapy – Sauna –Weights – Refreshments- TV – FUN!!!

YOGA will be held in a quiet secure area elsewhere in the facility! AND We have Massage Therapists on staff


See you Soon! This is a NATURIST Environment ...Clothing Optional, adjust at your own pace, sponsored by Maryland Area Naturist Yoga!


ADMISSION!


ALL ATTENDEES AGE 18-29 - $20/ 2@ $35 (Bring your classmates and groups! )

SWIM PREPAYMENT AVAILABLE!


==============

THE A TO Z!

ADDITIONAL RATES AFTER ADMISSION : YOGA $10 PAY CASH TO MARY DIRECTLY

MASSAGE - $15 for 15 Minute Minimum, MUST BE DRAPED

VENDORS – Interested in sharing your product or service? Ask!

AMENITIES : 100 degree SALT Pool and Gym Volleyball, Open Swim, Sauna (one reserved for women only) , Basketball, Free Weights, Ellipticals, Treadmill, Wall to wall TV’s , FREEDOM!

ATM : None on site. BRING CASH Use Stained Glass Pub/Hotel 1/8 mile away

NONDrivers: Take a Cab to the pool from trains, and our trusted volunteers get you back. USE DORSEY OR BWI MARC FROM PENN OR UNION STATION and most of our guests come from DC or Baltimore and may be able to give you a lift!http://mta.maryland.gov/marc-station-information; OUR STOPS : BWI – ODENTON – SAVAGE – DORSEY :All of these stops are a stones throw from our facility – Check the site and arrival times, plan to be at the stop about 5pm and cab it over. Some close earlier than others and Saturday times may vary

HOTEL BESIDE POOL Best Western Plus / Stained Glass Pub inside the hotel , thats the Location of our Happy Hour 6755 Dorsey Road, Elkridge, MD[masked] Dorsey Road, Elkridge, MD 21075

HOSTEL : URBAN CAMPING!http://www.hiusa.org/maryland/baltimore/baltimore :HOSTEL IN BALTIMORE, CHECK OUT THE INNER HARBOR – Located on Penn Line! Walking distance to Penn Station and 10 minute cab ride to pool. We suggest that if you have extra time, to do this and make a weekend out of it . Fells point and Harbor East are just a quick walk away . DC Location also!

BRING : Towel or mat for YOGA, LOCK for locker M/F , F/F couples and women have a separate locker room and sauna) Cash for admission, suit or robe if desired as we are CLOTHING OPTIONAL

YOGA BIO : MARY is www.meetup.com/Mhairi-Dances-and-Fitness-Meetup/ Looking forward to seeing you in class this Saturday! Do you have any suggestions for the event OR Poses you want to cover? We’ll get started around 6:30 (bring your $10 with you, but pay your admission at the door) See my link on MEETUP for details on other offerings including bellydancing!

MASSAGE BIO Sam is a Registered Massage Practitioner in the state of Maryland. She also has a creative side which can be observed atwww.facebook.com/sequoiazencreatesCheck out her massage website atwww.amtamembers.com/samanthawittmassage

NAKED VOLLEYBALL : Water Volleyball Tournaments Continue in 2015! Yes, we like playing in local gyms and in Downtown Baltimore, BUT… There are a half dozen opportunities within a 5 hour drive from Baltimore in summer months where novice to A players can compete sans stitch , registering on your own. FOR US..we have an Olympic sized pool where 1/3 will be reserved on thesecond swim each month firmly and the first one where theres interest to practice in our cozy 100 degree pool. Get your skills together and get in shape andhave some fun..by next summer you’ll be a pro! AND the gym is open for practice before and after yoga . Players of all levels can participate. A, B and AA to triple ZZZ divisions. Non-participants can watch the games poolside or swim in the open areas . ALL Rules and waivers apply! Pay admission. Discounts for students and groups , open to 18 and over , Swimsuit in the pool optional! Adjust how youre most comfortable, from diver wear to nothing. Heres a news story about Labor Day weekend activities about some friends who competed !http://sports.espn.go.com/espn/news/story?id=4537381 ;

WAIVER : Signed by All. Read Mary's Statement below for some of the understanding

NATURIST=FREEDOM As a reminder, the indoor event is in cooperation with a few other local meetups , that are offering a clothing optional experience! however this is not in anyway a sexual event. All of the attendees of the event, open to age 18 and over, have the option to dress, and undress, for comfort. Nudity is accepted and encouraged throughout the 10,000 Sf space, and is OPTIONAL in the pools and sauna. You may adjust at your own pace!

ANY issues and an administrator will eject the problem. If one activity isn’t for you, heres weights, treadmills, wall to wall TV’s , Pizza, Water Volleyball all 4 hrs and use of our yoga Volleyball court before and after class

VENDORS: Solar City and our Yoga and Massage Therapy providers are among several Vendors or interested supporters! At the very least, feel free to sketch our fellow nudes, we're all friendly!


SUPPORTING MEETUPS:

http://share.solarcity.com/a0p1400000gzb0iaah

http://www.meetup.com/Maryland-DC-SoCentralPA-Yoga-Volleyball-and-SpaNATURALLY/

http://www.meetup.com/DCMDNOVABANYAandSPA/(Additional trips to Spa World and other pools! )

ARTISTS!http://www.meetup.com/MDModelArtNMoreWithaTwist/suggestion/ (Sketch our nudes and share your work!)

http://www.meetup.com/Chesapeake-Potomac-Outdoors-Indoors-AllAround/

(Camping and Hiking group staying Busy for Winter! )

http://www.meetup.com/MDDCNoVaSoPAyogaswimspanaturally/

Please read the sites or rules and regs before responding

results.description:
Heres a UNIQUE REcreation Experience! Indoors in June!

We meet in the BWI / Arundel Mills area for several unique activities!

YOGA Session starts at 6:15! Arrive at the facility, pay cover,
NO ATM ON PREMISES, BRING CASH) relax in the hot pool or sauna for a few minutes.
ALL Ladies, and All ages 18-29 : $25 , 2 for $ 40
Guys 30 and over, $40
Couples $55
AANR / STUDENTS Age 18-29/Groups... be sure to ASK for your Admission discount!

YES - the event is Clothing Optional, if you want to dress, thats fine! Bring a Mat or Towel regardless!

YOGA: www.meetup.com/Mhairi-Dances-and-Fitness-Meetup/ Looking forward to seeing you in class ; Do you have any suggestions for the event OR Poses you want to cover? We’ll get started around 6:30 (bring your $10 with you, but pay your admission at the door) See my link on MEETUP for details on other offerings including bellydancing! USE THE YOGA GYM FOR VOLLEYBALL AS WELL AFTER CLASS!

ALSO ENJOY: MASSAGE w/ Aleasha! See Below!
VENDING of crafts and other items!

DIY Opportunities..ASK! 

NATURIST=FREEDOM As a reminder, the indoor event is in cooperation with a few other local meetups , that are offering a clothing optional experience! however this is not in anyway a sexual event. ANYONE ATTEMPTING TO SUGGEST OR ENGAGE IN ANY SEXUAL OR SEXUALLY SUGGESTIVE ACTIVITY WILL BE REQUIRED TO VACATE THE PREMISES IMMEDIATELY WITH NO REFUND OF ADMISSION OR ANY ACTIVITY FEES.

*****

Special GUEST MASSAGE THERAPIST!

Please welcome Aleasha Lewis as our Group's new Massage Therapist! Starting THIS SATURDAY! May 30th!
Aleasha A. Lewis, L.M.T., is a Maryland-licensed Massage Therapist, Vibrational Medicine Practitioner, and owner of EarthTouch Healing Arts in Dundalk, Maryland. She is often referred to as the “Healer’s Healer” and is regularly called upon by fellow bodyworkers or energy practitioners for her gifted and skilled abilities. EarthTouch offers a wide range of ancient and modern holistic healing modalities for body, mind and Spirit. Ms. Lewis specializes in clinical and relaxation therapeutic massage, Reiki, Zero Point Energy therapy and other scientific and esoteric healing techniques for holistic wellness. She is also a gifted Intuitive (used in energy work or intuitive sessions only, never massage) and has built a wide referral base from clients who trust their friends and family to her healing practice.
Ms. Lewis’ career and educational background is in law, education and clinical Massage Therapy. In addition to practicing client-centered Complementary and Alternative Medicine, Aleasha is also a published author in the field of holistic healthcare and conducts workshops, lectures and speaking engagements on various topics, including holistic health and Metaphysics and how this branch of scientific knowledge can be used to improve individual and global health and wellness. She has appeared in newspapers, on radio shows and has spoken to numerous college classes on various topics related to her work and success at EarthTouch Healing Arts.
Ms. Lewis is a member of the American Massage Therapy Association and Physicians' Committee for Responsible Medicine, is an officer and serves on the Board of Directors of the Community College of Baltimore County Alumni Association, and is a member of the Dundalk Renaissance Corporation and the Baltimore Council on Foreign Affairs. EarthTouch Healing Arts is a member of the Dundalk Chamber of Commerce. In her spare time, Aleasha enjoys nature, outdoor activities, travel, cultural and educational pursuits, involvement in, contribution to and activism in global and local social, ecological, and economic justice causes, volunteerism, reading, entertaining, her home, family, friends and pets, and assisting and mentoring others, which she is often called to do. More about the benefits of Massage Therapy and more about Aleasha A. Lewis, L.M.T. and the other holistic healing modalities she practices may be found atwww.earthtouchhealingarts.com

IMPORTANT: While you will note that some of the listed dates are clothing-optional events, Ms. Lewis remains fully-clothed at all times and observes all ethical, legal and hygienic rules for professional therapeutic massage, including draping and sanitization requirements. THERAPEUTIC MASSAGE IS A HEALTH CARE ACTIVITY AND IS COMPLETELY NON-SEXUAL. ANYONE ATTEMPTING TO SUGGEST OR ENGAGE IN ANY SEXUAL OR SEXUALLY SUGGESTIVE ACTIVITY WILL BE REQUIRED TO VACATE THE PREMISES IMMEDIATELY WITH NO REFUND OF ADMISSION OR MASSAGE THERAPY FEES.

Please see event information for admission fees to events. Massage Therapy is $15 for 15 minutes; additional time is available at $1 per minute. Gratuities accepted and appreciated.

results.description:
Our unique group “MARNA” Maryland Area Naturist Association is the Baltimore/Washington DC/South Central Pennsylvania Affiliate for “AANR” – American Association for Nude Recreation! 
www.marna.club / [masked]! If that sounds like a mouthful it is! Remember what we stand for..FUN!

SPECIAL THANKS to your moderators for allowing us to share this info

Events on deck : Camping and Hiking!

meetup.com/marnainmd/http://www.meetup.com/Mhairi-Dances-Fitness-Unique-Yoga-Meetp/yoga and bellydance instructor in Maryland! Interested in my class? DC and Baltimore area

WHILE NAKED YOGA is the main event there are several other activities for NON YOGIS and for you before and after class We offer events throughout the region from weekend camping trips to fellow campgrounds for all ages to a deluxe spa experience for 18 and over every other Saturday night! One of those events is coming up Saturday night April 25 th! CLOTHING OPTIONAL : About 250 locations and beaches across the USA have this designation – you may dress or not at your own pace! Attendees choose from many activities

We’re getting ready for a GREAT Saturday Night! Summer dates and weekend trips will soon be announced . Wherever you are , Maryland, DC, Virginia or travelling to join us and using the hotel or hostel option we have a GREAT Evening in store for Saturday!

See you Soon! This is a NATURIST Environment ...Clothing Optional, adjust at your own pace, sponsored by Maryland Area Naturist Yoga!


ADMISSION! ALL ATTENDEES AGE 18-29 - $20/ 2@ $35 (Bring your classmates and groups! ) *** SINGLE LADIES 30 AND OVER $25

***GUYS 30 AND OVER - $40* ** M/F Couple $55***Group rates available

SWIM PREPAYMENT AVAILABLE!


==============

THE A TO Z! ADDITIONAL RATES AFTER ADMISSION : YOGA $10 PAY CASH TO MARY DIRECTLY MASSAGE - $15 for 15 Minute Minimum, MUST BE DRAPED VENDORS – Interested in sharing your product or service? Ask! AMENITIES : 100 degree SALT Pool and Gym Volleyball, Open Swim, Sauna (one reserved for women only) , Basketball, Free Weights, Ellipticals, Treadmill, Wall to wall TV’s , FREEDOM!

ATM : None on site. BRING CASH Use Stained Glass Pub/Hotel 1/8 mile away

NONDrivers: Take a Cab to the pool from trains, and our trusted volunteers get you back. USE DORSEY OR BWI MARC FROM PENN OR UNION STATION and most of our guests come from DC or Baltimore and may be able to give you a lift! http://mta.maryland.gov/marc-station-information;

OUR STOPS : BWI – ODENTON – SAVAGE – DORSEY :All of these stops are a stones throw from our facility – Check the site and arrival times, plan to be at the stop about 5pm and cab it over. Some close earlier than others and Saturday times may vary HOTEL BESIDE POOL Best Western Plus / Stained Glass Pub inside the hotel , thats the Location of our Happy Hour 6755 Dorsey Road, Elkridge, MD[masked] Dorsey Road, Elkridge, MD 21075

HOSTEL : URBAN CAMPING! http://www.hiusa.org/maryland/baltimore/baltimore :HOSTEL IN BALTIMORE, CHECK OUT THE INNER HARBOR – Located on Penn Line! Walking distance to Penn Station and 10 minute cab ride to pool. We suggest that if you have extra time, to do this and make a weekend out of it . Fells point and Harbor East are just a quick walk away . DC Location also!

BRING : Towel or mat for YOGA, LOCK for locker M/F , F/F couples and women have a separate locker room and sauna) Cash for admission, suit or robe if desired as we are

CLOTHING OPTIONAL YOGA BIO : MARY is www.meetup.com/Mhairi-Dances-and-Fitness-Meetup/ Looking forward to seeing you in class this Saturday! Do you have any suggestions for the event OR Poses you want to cover? We’ll get started around 6:30 (bring your $10 with you, but pay your admission at the door) See my link on MEETUP for details on other offerings including bellydancing!

MASSAGE BIO Sam is a Registered Massage Practitioner in the state of Maryland. She also has a creative side which can be observed atwww.facebook.com/sequoiazencreatesCheck out her massage website at www.amtamembers.com/samanthawittmassage

NAKED VOLLEYBALL : Water Volleyball Tournaments Continue in 2015! Yes, we like playing in local gyms and in Downtown Baltimore, BUT… There are a half dozen opportunities within a 5 hour drive from Baltimore in summer months where novice to A players can compete sans stitch , registering on your own. FOR US..we have an Olympic sized pool where 1/3 will be reserved on thesecond swim each month firmly and the first one where theres interest to practice in our cozy 100 degree pool. Get your skills together and get in shape andhave some fun..by next summer you’ll be a pro! AND the gym is open for practice before and after yoga . Players of all levels can participate. A, B and AA to triple ZZZ divisions. Non-participants can watch the games poolside or swim in the open areas . ALL Rules and waivers apply! Pay admission. Discounts for students and groups , open to 18 and over , Swimsuit in the pool optional! Adjust how youre most comfortable, from diver wear to nothing. Heres a news story about Labor Day weekend activities about some friends who competed !http://sports.espn.go.com/espn/news/story?id=4537381 ;

WAIVER : Signed by All. Read Mary's Statement below for some of the understanding

NATURIST=FREEDOM As a reminder, the indoor event is in cooperation with a few other local meetups , that are offering a clothing optional experience! however this is not in anyway a sexual event. All of the attendees of the event, open to age 18 and over, have the option to dress, and undress, for comfort. Nudity is accepted and encouraged throughout the 10,000 Sf space, and is OPTIONAL in the pools and sauna. You may adjust at your own pace! ANY issues and an administrator will eject the problem. If one activity isn’t for you, heres weights, treadmills, wall to wall TV’s , Pizza, Water Volleyball all 4 hrs and use of our yoga Volleyball court before and after class

VENDORS: Solar City and our Yoga and Massage Therapy providers are among several Vendors or interested supporters! At the very least, feel free to sketch our fellow nudes, we're all friendly!


SUPPORTING MEETUPS:

http://share.solarcity.com/a0p1400000gzb0iaah

http://www.meetup.com/Maryland-DC-SoCentralPA-Yoga-Volleyball-and-SpaNATURALLY/

http://www.meetup.com/DCMDNOVABANYAandSPA/ (Additional trips to Spa World and other pools! ) ARTISTS! http://www.meetup.com/MDModelArtNMoreWithaTwist/suggestion/ (Sketch our nudes and share your work!)

See you soon!

--

results.description: Weird Al is performing a single concert at Pier Six as part of his "Mandatory Tour" and we are planning to go! Send Josh Turner an IM on Facebook by February 14 if you want a ticket in the group block. Tickets are $45 and payment will be to Josh so he can get a seat in the group block. This offer is for both Baltimare and DC group. There is also a much cheaper "Pier Seven" option being put together for those who can't afford actual seats or miss the deadline.
results.name: Weird Al Yankovic Live!

results.description:
The Awe Shack, 2510 Conway Rd, Suite 101, Gambrills, MD

website: http://theaweshack.com/

yelp review: http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-awe-shack-gambrills

This is a local Afghani (kabobs, etc.) restaurant with great reviews. Come meet your fellow meetup members. Let's talk about volunteer and charitable events we would like to do as a group. Let's share good food and fellowship. Hope to see you there!

-Charles

P.S. Please let us know what venues you would like for future events. If anyone wants to suggest and/or host an event - including volunteer activities and/or fun social events - please let me and/or any of the organizers know. Thank you!

P.P.S. At this event, please be prepared to: (a) take lots of pictures, and (b) share your favorite Bible verse.

results.description:
Bring your prayers and intentions along with your drums or other percussion instruments.

A drum circle is a fun experience that is accessible to anyone who wants to participate regardless of age or experience level. The goal is to achieve oneness with a group, not rhythmic perfection. Shamanism is the oldest spiritual belief system on earth. Drumming has been a method of group healing and achieving unity since the beginning of time. Studies have shown that drumming accelerates physical healing, boosts the immune system and produces feelings of well-being.

The drum circle will be held every 2nd Saturday of the month from 7:00 to 8:30 with time for socializing afterwards. Light refreshments will be provided. 

$5 - $10 voluntary donation. No one will be turned away if finances are an issue. All are welcome.

We encourage you to bring your drum or other instruments, but if you don't have any we have a few extras available.
results.how_to_find_us: Off of York Road in Timonium next to Nautilus Diner
results.name: Shamanic Drum Circle of Timonium

results.description:
Tour dem Parks, Hon! is Sunday, June 14th, 2015. This annual bike ride through Baltimore's parks and neighborhoods offers a close-up view of regional parks like Carroll, Patterson, Clifton and Druid Hill, as well as some quietly tucked away gems. Participants choose from 4 routes: 14 miles (the family ride on the Gwynn's Falls Trail), 25 miles, 35 miles. All rides start and end in Druid Hill Park.

Proceeds support Baltimore's parks, as well as environmental, "friends of parks", and cycling groups. Tour dem Parks, Hon! is fully supported with rest stops and ends with a jazz barbeque.


This year's ride is $50 for adults and $35 for youth 15 and under. But there are plenty of early bird discounts!

Valentine's Special  Feb 14 - Mar 31 Adults $35 / Youths 15 & under $20

April Fool's Special Apr 1 - Apr 30 Adults $40 / Youths 15 & under $20

May Day Special May 1 - May 31 Adults $45 / Youths 15 & under $20


June  Price (T-Shirts 1st not guaranteed after 5/31/2015) Jun 1 - Thu, Jun 11 Adults $50 / Youths 15 & under $20 .

Online Registration Closes 6/11
Registration at Druid Hill Park 6/14

More information at http://tourdemparks.org

results.description:
Update 3 (13-Jun-2015):  VHF Marine Channel should be set at 78 (not 68)

Update 2 (13-Jun-2015): Attn: 1.0 Mile & 4.4 Mile Kayakers

Below is a timeline illustration of the 4.4 Mile Swim that starts at 12:30pm. It shows the cutoff times that each swimmer must reach at each mile marker, who'll otherwise be removed from the race.


Since the 1.0 Mile Swim ends at 11:00am, there will be a 2-3hr lag time before the bulk of  the 4.4 Mile swimmers  reach the 1 mile mark.  Kayak support volunteers at Kent Island who will volunteer for both 1.0 & 4.4 Mile Swims  have several options:

1. Paddle across to Sandy Point to support the 4.4 Mile Swim and rendezvous w/Michael Matthews - Lead Kayak Support Coordinator


(Note: shipping lanes will remain open during this crossing period); or,

2. Paddle and station yourself along any of the bridge pillars to await 4.4 Mile Swimmers (btw: looong wait); or,


3.  Rest temporarily at the Hemingway Marina beachhead (after 11am):    Special permission has been granted by GCBS only AFTER 11 am (last swimmer).  Kayakers should not stay for more than 1 hour (end 12n-12:30pm).  All other kayakers who've finished for the day should return directly to the original launch site, but can join the GCBS festivities at Hemingway's afterwards.

MAP


Update 1 (11-Jun-2015) : At this time, all kayak support volunteers should have received an email with a link to download information, instructions and parking passes (1 Mile Swim, red pass; 4.4 mile swim, blue pass ) from GCBS organizers. Note: You will need to have a DropBox account to download the file (which is free to register).


For over 2 decades, The Great Chesapeake Bay Swim (GCBS) has relied on experienced kayakers who volunteer with the Safety Fleet to offer direct support for over 600 open water swimmers at its annual 4.4 Mile Swim across the Bay Bridge from Sandy Pt State Park in Annapolis to Hemmingway's Marina in Kent Island.


GCBS also features a  1 Mile Swim for over 400  swimmers along the sheltered cove by Hemmingway's Marina earlier the same morning, which is especially ideal for new volunteers who wish to gain experience in kayak swim support. It's a fun Maryland maritime, kayaking and sporting tradition with proceeds benefiting the March of Dimes.

For kayakers, it's always a fun event and a great experience for us to participate in this manner together with local, state and federal communities.

Primary duties:

Kayakers typically provide moral support, corrective orientation, temporary rest or assists with goggle/wetsuit corrections for the swimmers. However, since paddlers are the only watercraft permitted in the swim zone, we also serve to offer the first line of assistance to swimmers who either seek to withdraw or may appear weak or distressed. VHF marine radios are very useful and ideal for this event.


-------------------------------

For more details and info, please visit: http://www.bayswim.com/index.html

From GCBW: "Kayak Volunteers Wanted - The Great Chesapeake Bay Swim is seeking qualified Kayak Fleet volunteers for the upcoming event on June 14, 2015. The kayak fleet are integral members of the in-water safety net that surrounds the swimmers participating in the 4.4 mile GCBS and the 1 mile Chesapeake Challenge. Significant experience kayaking in open water, particularly the Chesapeake Bay, is a must. For additional information, please contact Vicki Saxon ([masked]) of the Great Chesapeake Bay Swim."

-------------------------------
Note: More specific details and information will be provided over the next few weeks. For a general feel of how it feels to volunteer, please check out my album at:

Here's more photos from last year's event:
https://www.facebook.com/domj.manalo.1/media_set?set=a.1439464662976249.1073741849.100007381865361&type=3
results.name: The Great Chesapeake Bay Swim - Kayak Safety Fleet (2015)

Anyone is welcome to join us. It's a fun event for kids. Lots of people even dress up. This is a fun event. Here is a link so you can see what past events look like: http://kineticbaltimore.com/

results.description:
The entire BWI trail is 12.5 miles but we will just do a about 5-6 miles of it (from  the Tom Dixon Aircraft Observation Area  for 2/ 12 to 3 miles to the Linthincum spur where we will turn around and head back (there are bathrooms at Tom Dixon and at Saw Mill Creek which we will detour to on the way ). We will leave at 9:10 am. My phone number is[masked] (Pat Brown) if you are lost or late or have to park at the overflow at Sawmill instead of Tom Dixon.

Parking for the BWI Trail is available at the Tom Dixon Observation Area on State Route 176/Dorsey Road, about 1 mile west of Interstate 97. If that lot is full, park at Sawmill Creek Park on SR 176 along the spur to the B&A Trail. Travel west on the John Overstreet Connector until you reach the BWI Trail. If you have to park at Sawmill, just call me and we will drive over and pick you up and bring you to Tom Dixon (and back at the end of the walk). No worries!

Here are some extra details on the parking lots in case you don't trust your GPS:

Tom Dixon Observation Area

From I-95 or Rt. 295 (Baltimore Washington Parkway) take Route 100 East. Stay on Route 100 to Exit 11. Get off Route 100 at Exit 11 which is Route 170 (Telegraph Road). Take Route 170 North towards Linthicum.  Go to the first stop light which is Route 176 (Dorsey Road). Make a right onto Route 176 and go approximately 1.5 miles. The observation area will be on your right. If you come to I-97, you have gone too far.

Sawmill Creek Park: From I-95 or Rt. 295 (Baltimore Washington Parkway) take Route 100 East. Stay on Route 100 to Exit 11. Get off Route 100 at Exit 11 which is Route 170 (Telegraph Road). Take Route 170 North towards Linthicum. Go to the first stop light which is Route 176 (Dorsey Road). Make a right onto Route 176. The park will be on your right just past I-97. If you come to 648, you have gone too far.
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet in the parking lot of the Tom Dixon Observation Area. I will be next to my red Mazda Miata convertible.
results.name: Walk Part of the BWI Trail

results.description:
Most of this walk is along the Columbia pathways and is paved and shaded and may be a little hilly in spots. A short 1/4-mile section will be along a street in a quiet neighborhood.  Total about 2 miles.

This is a leashed walk. I may need a volunteer to serve as a "sweep," so let me know if you'd be willing to go last and do some herding!

WHERE TO MEET:

Use the Google map above and park in the parking lot of the Clarys Forest pool at 11615 Little Patuxent Parkway.  http://goo.gl/maps/Oyq0F

Please arrive around 15 minutes early in order to allow the dogs to socialize and form a bond together.  This will provide a more enjoyable walk if they feel familiar with the other dogs, and share a community spirit.  Then we will step onto the trail right on time. Thank you!

*If you have signed up and have a last-minute change, call me at[masked], as a courtesy to all the participants.*

SAFETY:

There may be a few bikers, joggers or strollers that we come across, so please if you see an obstacle we should know about shout "On your left!" so we can keep our dogs out of the way of oncoming traffic.

                                                                  Photo by J. Coriale

PLEASE READ ALL OF THE BULLET POINTS :)

Columbia Dogs on the Go provides a way for friendly people with friendly dogs to meet on a voluntary basis. By replying "Yes" to this RSVP and attending this event, you acknowledge that:

•  You are responsible for your own safety and the safety of your dogs and any guests.

•  Your dogs are current on their vaccinations.

•  Your dogs will be kept on a leash (non-retractable) and under your control at the Meetup.

•  You will clean up after your dogs at the Meetup.

•  You will update your RSVP if your plans change.

•  You understand that the Meetup ends when the walk ends. (If you choose to meet other members at a restaurant, dog park, or other location, it is on your own time and not part of the Meetup event.)

                                                             Photo by R. Maretsky
